DOC.brief_title: Instrumental Sealing Arterial Puncture Site Closure Device Versus Manual Compression Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Vascular closure device show safe effective reducing time hemostasis immobilization compare manual compression follow coronary angiography . This effect beneficial patient present chronic back pain , prostate enlargement , mental impairment disorder preclude prolonged bed rest . However , adequately power large scale randomize trial vascular closure device remain gap scientific literature . This trial compare , randomise design two novel vascular closure device ( FemoSeal & ExoSeal ) versus manual compression coronary angiography . This study aim investigate novel vascular closure device noninferior manual compression regard access site complication .
DOC.criteria: Patient 18 85 year age Patients undergoing femoral access coronary angiography Access 6 F sheath Patient must competent provide informed write consent Peripheral arterial occlusive disease Prior peripheral artery surgery Percutaneous coronary intervention Femoral access device closure last 30 day Scheduled Coronary Angiography/Intervention within 90 day Critical limb ischemic Uncontrolled hypertension > 220/110 mmHg Coagulopathy ( bleed disorder ) Local infection Common femoral artery lumen diameter < 5 mm Allergy absorbable suture Autoimmune Disease Pregnancy
